name: Dialect
headline: Making internet experiences distributable and actionable everywhere
description:
Dialect is on a mission to organize the internet’s experiences and make them distributable and actionable everywhere. We’re doing this with blockchain links, or blinks, a new technology that lets businesses unbundle their product experiences from their apps and sites, allowing users to take instant, no-redirect actions wherever they are.

This technology is unique to blockchain today, but as the world moves onchain, it will redefine how we interact with the internet—everywhere.

founders.name: Chris Osborn, Founder
founders.description: Founder, Dialect | Former quantum engineer and software tech lead, Rigetti Computing | Physics Ph.D., Columbia University

generated_description:
**Dialect: Revolutionizing Internet Interactions**

Founded in 2019 and part of Y Combinator's Summer 2020 batch, Dialect is on an ambitious mission: to make internet experiences distributable and actionable everywhere. The company, based in New York, has developed a novel technology called blockchain links—affectionately referred to as "blinks." This technology allows businesses to unbundle their product experiences from their apps and websites. The result? Users can take swift, no-redirect actions from any interface, effectively transforming how we interact with the internet.

Dialect's approach stands out because it leverages blockchain technology in a way that’s unique to today's landscape. As we transition to an on-chain world, the implications of their work could redefine online interactions on a global scale.

The company's name is synonymous with the burgeoning sectors of crypto and Web3, and it serves a B2B market. With a tight-knit team of eight employees, and guided by their group partner Nan, Dialect is positioned to innovate within this rapidly evolving digital ecosystem.

For those interested in better understanding their technology, Dialect offers a range of resources on their website, including documentation and a GitHub repository for developers. They are actively working to integrate on-chain experiences into various applications, making it easier for users to engage without cumbersome redirects.

You can keep up with Dialect by visiting their website [here](https://dialect.to), where you’ll find access to additional resources, community channels, and insight into their ongoing developments.

In a world where internet efficiency matters more than ever, Dialect is not just participating in the conversation but actively reshaping it.
